metadata.job_title: Senior Data Engineer – Commerce Data Pipelines

seniority_level.evidence: Title explicitly states 'Senior Data Engineer' and requires 3+ years experience, which aligns with senior level in many organizations despite being on the lower end of typical senior ranges.

job_family.evidence: Job title is 'Senior Data Engineer' and responsibilities focus on ETL pipelines, data modeling, and SQL tuning — core data engineering functions.

sub_specialty.evidence: Must-have skills include ETL design/development, Airflow orchestration, and performance tuning — all indicative of batch ETL work. No streaming tools (Kafka, Flink, etc.) mentioned.

leadership_expectation.evidence: No mention of mentoring, managing teams, or architectural leadership. Responsibilities focus on building/maintaining pipelines and collaborating cross-functionally — typical IC role.

primary_cloud.evidence: Redshift is explicitly listed as a required skill, which is an AWS service. Snowflake is also mentioned but is cloud-agnostic; Redshift anchors the primary cloud to AWS.

secondary_clouds.evidence: No other cloud platforms (Azure, GCP) or services mentioned in skills or responsibilities.

processing_paradigm.evidence: ETL pipelines, Airflow orchestration, and scheduled data quality checks are all batch-oriented. No real-time or streaming tools mentioned.

orchestrator_category.evidence: Airflow is explicitly listed as a required skill under 'ETL orchestration tools'.

storage_layer.evidence: Snowflake and Redshift are both data warehouse technologies. No mention of data lakes, lakehouse formats (Delta, Iceberg), or raw storage layers.

remote_restriction.evidence: Location restricted to Seattle, Santa Monica, or NYC — all major US metro areas. Hybrid model (4 days onsite) implies regional presence required.

timezone_focus.evidence: Locations specified (Seattle, Santa Monica, NYC) are all in North America, implying Americas timezone focus.

relocation_required.evidence: Hybrid model requires 4 days onsite in one of three specific cities — implies candidate must relocate or already be in one of those locations.

h1b_friendly.evidence: Work authorization text explicitly excludes H1B: 'All valid EADs except OPT, CPT, H1B'.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: Work authorization text explicitly excludes OPT and CPT: 'All valid EADs except OPT, CPT, H1B'.

citizenship_required.evidence: Work authorization requirement states 'GC, USC, All valid EADs except OPT, CPT, H1B' — implies authorization to work in US is required, but not necessarily citizenship.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Explicitly states 'Up to $92.5/hr on W2 depending on experience (no C2C or 1099 or sub-contract)'.

benefits_level.evidence: Pass 1 extraction shows 'ext_benefits_mentioned: []' — no benefits listed in job posting.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: No mention of career paths, promotion ladders, or advancement opportunities in the job description or qualifications.

mentorship_signals.evidence: No mention of mentorship programs, assigned mentors, or learning from senior staff.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No mention of promotions, advancement, or career progression in the job posting.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal transfers, lateral moves, or exploring other roles within the company.

career_tracks_available.evidence: No mention of IC, management, specialist, or architect tracks in the job posting.

requirement_strictness.evidence: Clear 'Must Have' list with 10 hard skills and 3 soft skills, but no 'Nice to Have' skills — suggests moderate strictness without being overly rigid.

scope_definition.evidence: Focused on data engineering with specific responsibilities: ETL pipelines, data modeling, SQL tuning, and data quality — no ambiguity or multi-role blending.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Senior title with 3+ years experience is reasonable. Skills required (SQL, ETL, Airflow, Snowflake/Redshift) are standard for senior data engineers — no unrealistic combinations or inflated expectations.
